page.title: 12Coddenham/Hemingstone People
page.content: Coddenham village clusters round the two main streets with a population of about 500 while Hemingstone is a sprawling community of about 150. Both villages have far fewer related families than in the past and many newcomers, the great majority of whom travel to various occupations outside the area. Most houses are owner- occupied and well maintained. Young people mostly move away as house prices are fairly high and there are few to rent except for several holiday cottages. Originally the old Rectory at Coddenham and Hemingstone Hall were a source of employment for local people such as housemaids, coachmen, gardeners etc. Farmers employed a dozen or more men on the land but now can manage with just one or two members of the family. Retired people enjoy this attractive area.
